pages.text: $(item)Machine Bases$() are similar to $(l:rftoolsbase:basics/machine_frames)Machine Frames$() in that they are a crafting material, however the resulting machines are slightly different. $(br2)Machine Bases produce machines that are a quarter of a block high, and usually have some form of $(thing)redstone$() output or input.

When you place one of these machines, the direction it faces is determined by $(thing)which edge of the block your cursor is closest to$(). $(br2)It may help to imagine an X on the side of the block you are placing the machine on, then think about which 'quarter' of the X you're looking at. $(br2)The output will be facing this direction and the input will come from the opposite direction.

This is particularly useful for placing these machines in cramped spaces or on walls - which is one of the more convenient features of these blocks. $(br2)Of course, if you don't like the direction the block is facing in, you can always $(l:rftoolsbase:tools/smartwrench)Wrench$() it - just right-click with the wrench in Wrench Mode to change the direction it's facing in.

pages.heading: Machine Base
pages.text: The $(item)Machine Base$() does nothing on its own, but is used in many recipes as the base for other blocks.
